message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product, which is truly exceptional and worth more than $150 to me. Considering its unique features and high-quality craftsmanship, I would like to propose a price of $200 for it. I believe this reflects its true value and provides you with an opportunity to own something special. Please let me know if this offer interests you.

Hello Alice, thank you for offering the premium product. I appreciate the quality and uniqueness of the item. However, considering my budget and the fact that I am looking for a product worth no more than $150 to me, I would like to propose a counteroffer of $150 for the product. I hope this aligns better with what you're looking to receive for it.

Thank you for your interest in our premium product, Bob. I understand your position and appreciate your feedback. In light of your counteroffer, I would like to respectfully suggest a compromise. How about we set the price at $175? This acknowledges the value you place on the product while also allowing us to reach an agreement that respects both our positions. I look forward to your response.

Hello Alice, thank you for considering my previous counteroffer. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate further. Given my budget constraints and the value I place on the product, I would like to propose a final counteroffer of $160 for the product. I believe this price reflects a fair compromise between our positions.

Thank you for your continued interest, Bob. I appreciate your effort to find a mutually beneficial solution. In response to your latest counteroffer, I would like to propose a price of $165 for the product. This acknowledges the value you see in it while still reflecting the worth I place on it. I hope this proposal allows us to reach an agreement.

Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I've carefully considered our negotiation thus far, and I would like to propose a final counteroffer of $162 for the product. I believe this price is fair for both parties, acknowledging the value I see in the product while staying within my budget constraints.
